intro: Pentacalia arborea, commonly known as the tree pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually white or pale blue, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
